posts.post_content:
This set's [Training Drone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Drone).  
A little more difficult to work with. Expect to see it very late in the pack, 13-15th pick. People will take the basic land over it sometimes. But when you make the "soulbond deck" it has a chance of working out.

Posted By: JuggaSiC (4/29/2012 9:24:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Drawback aside, this guy is actually not bad for his cmc. Especially considering that it isn't colour heavy, which is important considering soulbond exists in different colours. If he was part of a casual deck that relied almost exclusively on soulbond it would feel like his drawback didn't exist. That makes it useful in extremely specific situations, and sort of fun in my opinion. I also enjoy the art and flavour.

posts.post_content:
It's big, it's heavy, it's wood,  
It's better than bad, it's good!  
  
I recently played a draft with The Log and a bunch of crappy soulbonders like [Galvanic Alchemist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Galvanic Alchemist) and [Diregraf Escort](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diregraf Escort) and won a few games. I mostly got my butt kicked, but that was due to my low skill level, not to any inherent suckitude of The Log.

posts.post_content:
*Only works with cards in its own set. Hate cards like this.  
  
At least things like infect work throughout an entire block (and that's ignoring the occasional thing like Snake Cult Initiation), and you can make a really good infect deck with 8 or fewer infect creatures. This is just a splashable Leatherback Baloth equivalent that makes you terrified of your opponent's Murders.*
posts.html:
